title: incorrect/unexpected behaviour with recursive trait bounds on associated types
body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

I tried this code:

```rust
struct Parent { data: u32 }
struct ChildA { parent: &'static Parent }
struct ChildB { parent: &'static ChildA }


trait Object {}

trait ChildObject {
    type Parent: Object;
    fn get_parent(&self) -> &'static Self::Parent;
}

trait GetData {
    fn get_data(&self) -> u32 where
        Self: ChildObject,
        Self::Parent: GetData,
    {
        self.get_parent().get_data()
    }
}


impl Object for ChildA {}
impl Object for ChildB {}
impl Object for Parent {}

impl ChildObject for ChildA {
    type Parent = Parent;
    
    fn get_parent(&self) -> &'static Parent {
        &self.parent
    }
}

impl ChildObject for ChildB {
    type Parent = ChildA;
    
    fn get_parent(&self) -> &'static ChildA {
        &self.parent
    }
}

impl GetData for Parent {
    fn get_data(&self) -> u32 {
        self.data
    }
}

impl GetData for ChildA {}
impl GetData for ChildB {}
```


This code does not compile. Instead I get the following error message:
```rust
error[E0277]: the trait bound `<Self as ChildObject>::Parent: ChildObject` is not satisfied
  --> <anon>:18:27
   |
16 |         Self::Parent: GetData,
   |                               - help: consider further restricting the associated type: `, <Self as ChildObject>::Parent: ChildObject`
17 |     {
18 |         self.get_parent().get_data()
   |                           ^^^^^^^^ the trait `ChildObject` is not implemented for `<Self as ChildObject>::Parent`
```

`rustc` seems to assume that `ChildObject::Parent` also needs to implement `ChildObject` to implement `GetData`, since the default implementations of `GetData` require that bound.

In the case of `Parent` all default implementations are overwritten so this bound is no longer required.



### Meta
<!--
If you're using the stable version of the compiler, you should also check if the
bug also exists in the beta or nightly versions.
-->

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.41.0 (5e1a79984 2020-01-27)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 5e1a799842ba6ed4a57e91f7ab9435947482f7d8
commit-date: 2020-01-27
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.41.0
LLVM version: 9.0
```
and 
```
rustc 1.43.0-nightly (8aa9d2014 2020-02-21)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 8aa9d2014f4e5258f83b907e8431c59a33acdae7
commit-date: 2020-02-21
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.43.0-nightly
LLVM version: 9.0
```
